conversation.text: I would highly recommend "The Secret" to you. This classic film stars Genevieve O'Reilly and Eric Cantona, among others. The film follows a mysterious stranger who enters into and forever alters the life of a couple. He claims to be pursued by certain authorities who intend to prevent him from disclosing a secret that only he holds, whence the title. Is he lying, or insane  - or is he telling the truth? Who, if anyone, is after him? And what  *is*  - the secret? "The Secret" is a timeless classic that will stay with you long after you have watched it. So why not give it a watch and see if you don't enjoy it as much as many other people do

Based on the user's preference cues and the given list, I would recommend "The Last Unicorn" and "Taxi Driver". 

"The Last Unicorn" is a classic fantasy film directed by Ron Howard. The movie tells the story of a beautiful unicorn who sets out to learn if she truly is the last of her kind in this sparkling animated musical.

On the other hand, "Taxi Driver" is a 1976 American crime drama film directed by Martin Scorsese and starring Harvey Keitel, Albert Brooks, and Robert De Niro. The movie tells the story of a New York City taxi driver who becomes obsessed with a young woman named Dolores (played by Cybill Shepherd) who he assumes has been involved in a sex ring run by gangster Jimmy "The Weasel" Colo.
